content.description: This is the line to the right of the bent tree. Climb up through the overhangs to the rest ledge. Climb past 2 prehung draws crux and up the final face to the anchors. (Some folks climb this route to the rest ledge and lower from the fixed chain draw 5.9+ AKA: Soul)

Start in front of the Bent tree. Climb up the continuous overhangs to the final lip with a fixed chain draw. Pull the lip and finish on easier face climbing above. Most people stick clip the first bolt.

Climb slightly overhanging face to a crux at the third bolt.  A section of easier climbing follows.  Then, continue up the short corner/crack section past the final bolt to the shuts.  This climb has seen some serious accidents. Please consider the final moves and be competent at the suggested grade.  It can be tricky and a ledge fall is the outcome if your not a solid 5.8 leader.  Proceed with caution and have fun!

Climb up past the first several bolts to the roof. pull the roof to the inside pink corner climb the corner up to rest ledge.  NOTE: The bolt at the large rest ledge is hard to clip for short people.  Continue up the next corner to below the main large overhang.  Traverse left across the exposed face to the clip at the point.  Pull up and over to easier climbing and the shuts above.  A super fun line, with some commiting moves.

Climb start just right of the water streaks through several overhangs passing "the block that should not be" on your left. Continue up the face to the final overhangs. Finishes at the chains at the lip.
content.protection: 7 bolts, lower from chain/biner at lip.

content.description: Start below the first bolt, clip bolt and move right and follow the arete passing 2 more bolts.  Crux at 3rd bolt. Finish at ring shuts under roof.(Continuing past the shuts is Good Day to Die 5.11a)
Climb a slightly overhanging face to a crux at the third bolt. Surmount ledge and continue up easier climbing to shuts.  Much easier than Metamorphosis and Firefly.
Shares the same start as Firefly.  Climb firefly to the shuts.  Clip a shut and continue over the akward bulge to the face climbing above.
Fun, popular and great for a new leader.  Crux is height dependent only (kids have problems reaching the next hold), but can be avoided by moving right.  Slight rope drag when lowering from top.

Climb the first 3 bolts of Soul Rebel to the rest ledge. At the rest ledge move right out balancy moves and up through the overhangs to the lip. Pull the lip and finish on the face above. Has its own anchors.
content.location: rightmost bolted climb at the cliff.  Shares the same start at Soul Rebel.

content.description: The 2nd climbable crag. Probably the most popular of the crags.  It is about 90' tall at its highest point with most routes being about 70'.  Mostly steep overhanging sport routes with great photo potential. Several moderate sport routes also exist to the left end of the cliff.
